intro: Cordemoya hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cordemoy, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs.
